oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Andrew Jackson Postage Stamp
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A pen and ink drawing of the 1861 postage stamp honoring Andrew Jackson. The authentic stamp is surrounded by the drawing. The caption reads: "Andrew Jackson, Seventh President of the U.S.A.,1829-1837. Postage Stamp with Portrait of Andrew Jackson issued 1861."

A full face of Andrew Jackson fills the entire tablet, which is as wide as the stamp, three-fourths of an inch, and only 1/16 less in its long diameter than the stamp, 15/16 of an inch, space being left at the top for the words "U.S. postage" above the elliptical ground, which is cross-hatched. It is a two-cent stamp and engraved by Joseph Pease.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wall, Bernhardt, 1872-1956
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845; United States Postal Service
Postage stamps
